Posts.Content: Sep 30, 2012 07:29PM regenschirm wrote: I am 18 days post surgery and feel the same way--tight. Also eating small portions. I am transitioning from a binder to girdle which I am supposed to wear 24hrs a day for 6 weeks. After that just during the day. I think it helps some with the bloating. Definitely adds support.
Posts.Title: Two DIEP Questions J-Bug Diane31

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2011 10:24AM regenschirm wrote: I have taken levaquin without incident.   It's pretty effective when you need it.   I would recommend taking either a probiotic caplet or yogurt drinks with active cultures.  It can help with the GI side effects.
Posts.Title: Levaquin (levofloxacin) TAPPY TAPPY

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2011 10:50AM regenschirm wrote: I am going to MD Anderson next week.    I'm riddled with anxiety about finding out something new (on the one hand) and at the same time just so relieved to be going to a place where there is expertise.    I hit the end of my rope when I went for a pre op appt and the surgeon expressed that he thought my case was complex and "not in any text book".  This was the first time I heard anything like that (and it is probably a blessing in disguise because it motivated me to pursure the consult at MDA).   But I'm so freaking tired at this point.  I already know in advance I want to do my surgery there.   Was it difficult to schedule that?  Worried that the longer I wait out from chemo (now 6 weeks) the greater the likelihood that this beast will reawaken.
Posts.Title: MD Anderson Second Opinion irish22 Timbuktu

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2011 07:06PM regenschirm wrote: I'm right there with  you.  Surgery on the 16th.  I'm still crawling out of the chemo cave but each week has been a bit better.  We went to FL for the Thanksgiving holiday and sat on the beach with the kids.  It was a much needed break (since breast cancer robbed us of our summer).   I feel stronger now moving forwards.   We are simplying this holiday-putting up 1/3 the decorations.   It's so nice.   So much less stressful.  I wonder why we do that to ourselves?  Stress over the holidays?   Not worth it!

Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2011 10:37AM - edited Nov 3, 2011 10:37AM by regenschirm I will be having BMX in dec. just had last chemo infusion yesterday. The plan is for direct to the diep flap. But we are having on going discussions about ddoing tissue expander first and finishing step later. Some of this will be determined by my MRI in two weeks. And whether or not I am a candidate for radiation. Soon ready to move forwards.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Dec 2011 hawaiik Blessings2011

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2011 07:04PM regenschirm wrote: I'm scheduled for BMX with immediate diep flap reconstruction on dec. 16. Currently working on rebounding from my last chemotherapy round. I did 6rounds of neoadjuvant taxotere cytoxan and adriamycin.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Dec 2011 hawaiik Blessings2011

Posts.Content: Nov 10, 2011 10:28AM regenschirm wrote: I wholeheartedly agree-those early days are the hardest. Take a moment and breathe. It sounds nuts but I did it often. I couldn't sleep at all for the first couple of weeks. I listened to music took walks. Once I had a game plan, I entered warrior mode. My story is similar to yours. I have three young boys. Found a lump in a self exam. In my case I have multifocal disease. I just finished the last round of chemo and have a surgery date scheduled. A friend of mine pointed out two positives (won't say good because it isn't it just all around sucks) to doing chemo first: you will see that your cancer responds to the meds and if there has been spread you are hitting it hard up front. In my case we are hoping for a better surgical outcome by doing chemo first. You absolutely can do this. Baby steps still move you closer to putting all of this in the rearview. Just remember to breathe.
Posts.Title: Terrified. New here. AmyLB maryhelen

Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2011 11:21PM regenschirm wrote: Feeling massively overwhelmed at the moment. Met general surgeon today. He is the first one to tell me he doesn't think I should do immediate recon. That I need axillary lymph node dissection. I find it maddening that I am learning this one week from my scheduled surgery date. As things stand right now I am scheduled for the BMX with no recon. So much to process. New date is dec 27. PLan to have ovaries out at the same time. Premise for this is that we don't know how much of the cancer is dcis vs invasive multicentric disease. Most important thing is to fight the cancer. But after months of fight I'm feeling exhausted. This is a lonely road.
Posts.Title: December 2011 Surgeries - want to wait together? CookieMonster Moonflwr912

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2011 04:13PM regenschirm wrote: I'm scheduled for BMX and immediate diep on dec. 16. I wasnt expecting the anxiety level to be so high. Got my post chemo MRI results yesterday and was disappointed that the effect wasn't more dramatic. Doc says we won't really know what is going on with me until the surgical path comes in. So hard to wait and be calm with uncertainty. We don't know how much of my "non mass like enhancement" is invasive and how much dcis. Overall dimension went from 5x6 to 4 x5 approximately. Also overall signal intensity went down. So now I wait and try to do things to be healthy and recover from chemo.
Posts.Title: December 2011 Surgeries - want to wait together? CookieMonster Moonflwr912

Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2011 12:31AM regenschirm wrote: Shaking off my upset from wed. consult with the general surgeon I have decided to go to md Anderson for an opinion on the whole thing. I was told I'm not in any textbook and that my case is complicated. It seems no two people agree. So I'm going where the experts are and feel good about the decision. May not end up as a dec surgery.

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2011 02:51AM regenschirm wrote: I'm having the oophorectomy as well.  But later, after I heal from the Diep.    It's odd to have gone through life with very few medical experiences, no surgery, to be hit all at once with the biopsies, chemo, etc.   Odd and overwhelming.  I've been in total "fight" mode but the last few days feel pretty depleted.  Need to recharge.   The next 4 weeks need to be calm.
